register.name: ACTLR_EL3
register.description: Provides IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED configuration and control options for EL3.

register.name: AFSR0_EL3
register.description: Provides additional IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED fault status information for exceptions taken to EL3.

register.name: AFSR1_EL3
register.description: Provides additional IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED fault status information for exceptions taken to EL3.

register.name: AMAIR_EL3
register.description: Provides IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED memory attributes for the memory regions specified by MAIR_EL3.

register.name: CPTR_EL3
register.description: Controls trapping to EL3 of access to CPACR_EL1, CPTR_EL2, trace functionality and registers associated with Advanced SIMD and floating-point execution. Also controls EL3 access to trace functionality and registers associated with Advanced SIMD and floating-point execution.

bitField.name: TCPAC
bitField.description: Traps all of the following to EL3, from both Security states and both Execution states.

bitField.name: TTA
bitField.description: Traps System register accesses to the trace registers, from all Exception levels, both Security states, and both Execution states, to EL3.

bitField.name: TFP
bitField.description: Traps all accesses to Advanced SIMD and floating-point functionality, from all Exception levels, both Security states, and both Execution states, to EL3.

register.name: ICC_CTLR_EL3
register.description: Controls aspects of the behavior of the GIC CPU interface and provides information about the features implemented.

bitField.name: nDS
bitField.description: Disable Security not supported. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: A3V
bitField.description: Affinity 3 Valid. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: SEIS
bitField.description: SEI Support. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: IDbits
bitField.description: Identifier bits. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: PRIbits
bitField.description: Priority bits. Read-only and writes are ignored. The number of priority bits implemented, minus one.

bitField.name: PMHE
bitField.description: Priority Mask Hint Enable.

bitField.name: RM
bitField.description: Routing Modifier. For legacy operation of EL1 software with GICC_CTLR.FIQen set to 1, this bit indicates whether interrupts can be acknowledged or observed as the Highest Priority Pending Interrupt, or whether a special INTID value is returned.

bitField.name: EOImode_EL1NS
bitField.description: EOI mode for interrupts handled at Non-secure EL1 and EL2.

bitField.name: EOImode_EL1S
bitField.description: EOI mode for interrupts handled at Secure EL1.

bitField.name: EOImode_EL3
bitField.description: EOI mode for interrupts handled at EL3.

bitField.name: CBPR_EL1NS
bitField.description: Common Binary Point Register, EL1 Non-secure.

bitField.name: CBPR_EL1S
bitField.description: Common Binary Point Register, EL1 Secure.

register.name: ICC_SRE_EL3
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller System Register Enable register (EL3)
register.description: Controls whether the System register interface or the memory-mapped interface to the GIC CPU interface is used for EL3.

bitField.name: Enable
bitField.description: Enable. Enables lower Exception level access to ICC_SRE_EL1 and ICC_SRE_EL2.

bitField.name: DIB
bitField.description: Disable IRQ bypass.

bitField.name: DFB
bitField.description: Disable FIQ bypass.

bitField.name: SRE
bitField.description: System Register Enable.

register.name: MDCR_EL3
register.description: Provides EL3 configuration options for self-hosted debug and the Performance Monitors Extension.

bitField.name: EPMAD
bitField.description: External debug interface Performance Monitors registers disable.

bitField.name: EDAD
bitField.description: External debug interface breakpoint and watchpoint register access disable.

bitField.name: SPME
bitField.description: Secure Performance Monitors enable.

bitField.name: SDD
bitField.description: AArch64 Secure self-hosted invasive debug disable. Disables Software debug exceptions in Secure state, other than Breakpoint Instruction exceptions.

bitField.name: SPD32
bitField.description: AArch32 Secure self-hosted privileged invasive debug control. Enables or disables debug exceptions from Secure EL1 using AArch32, other than Breakpoint Instruction exceptions.

bitField.name: TDOSA
bitField.description: Trap debug OS-related register access.

bitField.name: TDA
bitField.description: Trap Debug Access. Traps EL2, EL1, and EL0 System register accesses to those debug System registers that cannot be trapped using the MDCR_EL3.TDOSA field. When MDCR_EL3.

bitField.name: TPM
bitField.description: Trap Performance Monitors accesses. Traps EL2, EL1, and EL0 accesses to all Performance Monitors registers to EL3, from both Security states and both Execution states.

register.name: SCR_EL3
register.description: Defines the configuration of the current Security state. It specifies...

bitField.name: TERR
bitField.description: Trap Error record accesses.

bitField.name: TLOR
bitField.description: Trap LOR registers. Traps accesses to the LORSA_EL1, LOREA_EL1, LORN_EL1, LORC_EL1, and LORID_EL1 registers from EL1 and EL2 to EL3, unless the access has been trapped to EL2.

bitField.name: TWE
bitField.description: Traps EL2, EL1, and EL0 execution of WFE instructions to EL3, from both Security states and both Execution states.

bitField.name: TWI
bitField.description: Traps EL2, EL1, and EL0 execution of WFI instructions to EL3, from both Security states and both Execution states.

bitField.name: ST
bitField.description: Traps Secure EL1 accesses to the Counter-timer Physical Secure timer registers to EL3, from AArch64 state only.

bitField.name: RW
bitField.description: Execution state control for lower Exception levels.

bitField.name: SIF
bitField.description: Secure instruction fetch. When the PE is in Secure state, this bit disables instruction fetch from Non-secure memory.

bitField.name: HCE
bitField.description: Hypervisor Call instruction enable. Enables HVC instructions at EL3, EL2, and Non-secure EL1, in both Execution states.

bitField.name: SMD
bitField.description: Secure Monitor Call disable. Disables SMC instructions at EL1 and above, from both Security states and both Execution states.

bitField.name: EA
bitField.description: External Abort and SError Interrupt Routing.

bitField.name: FIQ
bitField.description: Physical FIQ Routing.

bitField.name: IRQ
bitField.description: Physical IRQ Routing.

bitField.name: NS
bitField.description: Non-secure bit.

register.name: SDER32_EL3
register.description: Allows access to the AArch32 register SDER from AArch64 state only. Its value has no effect on execution in AArch64 state.

bitField.name: SUNIDEN
bitField.description: Secure User Non-Invasive Debug Enable:

bitField.name: SUIDEN
bitField.description: Secure User Invasive Debug Enable:

register.name: VBAR_EL3
register.description: Holds the vector base address for any exception that is taken to EL3.

tcf:enumItem.description: This control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.
tcf:enumItem.name: This_control_does_not_cause_any_instructions_to_be_trapped

tcf:enumItem.description: EL2 accesses to the CPTR_EL2 or HCPTR, and EL2 and EL1 accesses to the CPACR_EL1 or CPACR, are trapped to EL3, unless they are trapped by CPTR_EL2.TCPAC.
tcf:enumItem.name: EL2_accesses_to_the_CPTR_EL2_or_HCPTR_and_EL2_and_EL1_accesses_to_the_CPACR_EL1_or_CPACR_are_trapped_to_EL3_unless_they_are_trapped_by_CPTR_EL2

tcf:enumItem.description: This control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.
tcf:enumItem.name: This_control_does_not_cause_any_instructions_to_be_trapped

tcf:enumItem.description: Any System register access to the trace registers is trapped to EL3, subject to the exception prioritization rules, unless it is trapped by CPACR.NSTRCDIS, CPACR_EL1.TTA or CPTR_EL2.TTA.
tcf:enumItem.name: Any_System_register_access_to_the_trace_registers_is_trapped_to_EL3_subject_to_the_exception_prioritization_rules_unless_it_is_trapped_by_CPACR

tcf:enumItem.description: This control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.
tcf:enumItem.name: This_control_does_not_cause_any_instructions_to_be_trapped

tcf:enumItem.description: Any attempt at any Exception level to execute an instruction that uses the registers associated with Advanced SIMD and floating-point is trapped to EL3, subject to the exception prioritization rules, unless it is trapped by CPACR.cp10, CPACR_EL1.FPEN, or CPTR_EL2.TFP.
tcf:enumItem.name: Any_attempt_at_any_Exception_level_to_execute_an_instruction_that_uses_the_registers_associated_with_Advanced_SIMD_and_floating_point_is_trapped_to_EL3_subject_to_the_exception_prioritization_rules_unless_it_is_trapped_by_CPACR

tcf:enumItem.description: The CPU interface logic supports disabling of security.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_CPU_interface_logic_supports_disabling_of_security

tcf:enumItem.description: The CPU interface logic does not support disabling of security, and requires that security is not disabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_CPU_interface_logic_does_not_support_disabling_of_security_and_requires_that_security_is_not_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: The CPU interface logic does not support non-zero values of the Aff3 field in SGI generation System registers.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_CPU_interface_logic_does_not_support_non_zero_values_of_the_Aff3_field_in_SGI_generation_System_registers

tcf:enumItem.description: The CPU interface logic supports non-zero values of the Aff3 field in SGI generation System registers.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_CPU_interface_logic_supports_non_zero_values_of_the_Aff3_field_in_SGI_generation_System_registers

tcf:enumItem.description: The CPU interface logic does not support generation of SEIs.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_CPU_interface_logic_does_not_support_generation_of_SEIs

tcf:enumItem.description: The CPU interface logic supports generation of SEIs.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_CPU_interface_logic_supports_generation_of_SEIs

tcf:enumItem.description: 16 bits.
tcf:enumItem.name: _16_bits

tcf:enumItem.description: 24 bits.
tcf:enumItem.name: _24_bits

tcf:enumItem.description: Disables use of the priority mask register as a hint for interrupt distribution.
tcf:enumItem.name: Disables_use_of_the_priority_mask_register_as_a_hint_for_interrupt_distribution

tcf:enumItem.description: Enables use of the priority mask register as a hint for interrupt distribution.
tcf:enumItem.name: Enables_use_of_the_priority_mask_register_as_a_hint_for_interrupt_distribution

tcf:enumItem.description: Secure Group 0 and Non-secure Group 1 interrupts can be acknowledged and observed as the highest priority interrupt at the Secure Exception level where the interrupt is taken.
tcf:enumItem.name: Secure_Group_0_and_Non_secure_Group_1_interrupts_can_be_acknowledged_and_observed_as_the_highest_priority_interrupt_at_the_Secure_Exception_level_where_the_interrupt_is_taken

tcf:enumItem.description: When accessed at EL3 in AArch64 state...
tcf:enumItem.name: When_accessed_at_EL3_in_AArch64_state

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_EOIR0_EL1 and ICC_EOIR1_EL1 provide both priority drop and interrupt deactivation functionality. Accesses to ICC_DIR_EL1 are UNPREDICTABLE.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_EOIR0_EL1_and_ICC_EOIR1_EL1_provide_both_priority_drop_and_interrupt_deactivation_functionality

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_EOIR0_EL1 and ICC_EOIR1_EL1 provide priority drop functionality only. ICC_DIR_EL1 provides interrupt deactivation functionality.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_EOIR0_EL1_and_ICC_EOIR1_EL1_provide_priority_drop_functionality_only

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_EOIR0_EL1 and ICC_EOIR1_EL1 provide both priority drop and interrupt deactivation functionality. Accesses to ICC_DIR_EL1 are UNPREDICTABLE.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_EOIR0_EL1_and_ICC_EOIR1_EL1_provide_both_priority_drop_and_interrupt_deactivation_functionality

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_EOIR0_EL1 and ICC_EOIR1_EL1 provide priority drop functionality only. ICC_DIR_EL1 provides interrupt deactivation functionality.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_EOIR0_EL1_and_ICC_EOIR1_EL1_provide_priority_drop_functionality_only

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_EOIR0_EL1 and ICC_EOIR1_EL1 provide both priority drop and interrupt deactivation functionality. Accesses to ICC_DIR_EL1 are UNPREDICTABLE.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_EOIR0_EL1_and_ICC_EOIR1_EL1_provide_both_priority_drop_and_interrupt_deactivation_functionality

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_EOIR0_EL1 and ICC_EOIR1_EL1 provide priority drop functionality only. ICC_DIR_EL1 provides interrupt deactivation functionality.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_EOIR0_EL1_and_ICC_EOIR1_EL1_provide_priority_drop_functionality_only

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_BPR0_EL1 determines the preemption group for Group 0 interrupts only...
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_BPR0_EL1_determines_the_preemption_group_for_Group_0_interrupts_only

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_BPR0_EL1 determines the preemption group for Group 0 interrupts and Non-secure Group 1 interrupts. Non-secure accesses to GICC_BPR and ICC_BPR1_EL1 access the state of ICC_BPR0_EL1.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_BPR0_EL1_determines_the_preemption_group_for_Group_0_interrupts_and_Non_secure_Group_1_interrupts

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_BPR0_EL1 determines the preemption group for Group 0 interrupts only...
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_BPR0_EL1_determines_the_preemption_group_for_Group_0_interrupts_only

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_BPR0_EL1 determines the preemption group for Group 0 interrupts and Secure Group 1 interrupts. Secure EL1 accesses to ICC_BPR1_EL1 access the state of ICC_BPR0_EL1.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_BPR0_EL1_determines_the_preemption_group_for_Group_0_interrupts_and_Secure_Group_1_interrupts

tcf:enumItem.description: Secure EL1 accesses to Secure ICC_SRE_EL1 trap to EL3...
tcf:enumItem.name: Secure_EL1_accesses_to_Secure_ICC_SRE_EL1_trap_to_EL3

tcf:enumItem.description: Secure EL1 accesses to Secure ICC_SRE_EL1 do not trap to EL3...
tcf:enumItem.name: Secure_EL1_accesses_to_Secure_ICC_SRE_EL1_do_not_trap_to_EL3

tcf:enumItem.description: IRQ bypass enabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: IRQ_bypass_enabled

tcf:enumItem.description: IRQ bypass disabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: IRQ_bypass_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: FIQ bypass enabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: FIQ_bypass_enabled

tcf:enumItem.description: FIQ bypass disabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: FIQ_bypass_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: The memory-mapped interface must be used. Access at EL3 to any ICH_* or ICC_* register other than ICC_SRE_EL1, ICC_SRE_EL2, or ICC_SRE_EL3 is trapped to EL3
tcf:enumItem.name: The_memory_mapped_interface_must_be_used

tcf:enumItem.description: The System register interface to the ICH_* registers and the EL1, EL2, and EL3 ICC_* registers is enabled for EL3.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_System_register_interface_to_the_ICH_registers_and_the_EL1_EL2_and_EL3_ICC_registers_is_enabled_for_EL3

tcf:enumItem.description: Access to Performance Monitors registers from external debugger is permitted.
tcf:enumItem.name: Access_to_Performance_Monitors_registers_from_external_debugger_is_permitted

tcf:enumItem.description: Access to Performance Monitors registers from external debugger is disabled, unless overridden by the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED authentication interface.
tcf:enumItem.name: Access_to_Performance_Monitors_registers_from_external_debugger_is_disabled_unless_overridden_by_the_IMPLEMENTATION_DEFINED_authentication_interface

tcf:enumItem.description: Access to breakpoint and watchpoint registers from external debugger is permitted.
tcf:enumItem.name: Access_to_breakpoint_and_watchpoint_registers_from_external_debugger_is_permitted

tcf:enumItem.description: Access to breakpoint and watchpoint registers from external debugger is disabled, unless overridden by the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED authentication interface.
tcf:enumItem.name: Access_to_breakpoint_and_watchpoint_registers_from_external_debugger_is_disabled_unless_overridden_by_the_IMPLEMENTATION_DEFINED_authentication_interface

tcf:enumItem.description: Event counting prohibited in Secure state, unless ExternalSecureNoninvasiveDebugEnabled() is TRUE, meaning this control is overridden by the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED authentication interface.
tcf:enumItem.name: Event_counting_prohibited_in_Secure_state_unless_ExternalSecureNoninvasiveDebugEnabled_is_TRUE_meaning_this_control_is_overridden_by_the_IMPLEMENTATION_DEFINED_authentication_interface

tcf:enumItem.description: Event counting allowed in Secure state.
tcf:enumItem.name: Event_counting_allowed_in_Secure_state

tcf:enumItem.description: Debug exceptions from Secure EL0 are enabled, and debug exceptions from Secure EL1 are enabled if the value of MDSCR_EL1.KDE is 1 and the value of PSTATE.D is 0.
tcf:enumItem.name: Debug_exceptions_from_Secure_EL0_are_enabled_and_debug_exceptions_from_Secure_EL1_are_enabled_if_the_value_of_MDSCR_EL1

tcf:enumItem.description: Debug exceptions, other than Breakpoint Instruction exceptions, are disabled from all Exception levels in Secure state.
tcf:enumItem.name: Debug_exceptions_other_than_Breakpoint_Instruction_exceptions_are_disabled_from_all_Exception_levels_in_Secure_state

tcf:enumItem.description: Legacy mode. Debug exceptions from Secure EL1 are enabled by the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED authentication interface.
tcf:enumItem.name: Legacy_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: Secure privileged debug disabled. Debug exceptions from Secure EL1 are disabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: Secure_privileged_debug_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: Secure privileged debug enabled. Debug exceptions from Secure EL1 are enabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: Secure_privileged_debug_enabled

tcf:enumItem.description: This control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.
tcf:enumItem.name: This_control_does_not_cause_any_instructions_to_be_trapped

tcf:enumItem.description: EL2 and EL1 System register accesses to the powerdown debug registers are trapped to EL3, unless it is trapped by HDCR.TDOSA or MDCR_EL2.TDOSA.
tcf:enumItem.name: EL2_and_EL1_System_register_accesses_to_the_powerdown_debug_registers_are_trapped_to_EL3_unless_it_is_trapped_by_HDCR

tcf:enumItem.description: This control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.
tcf:enumItem.name: This_control_does_not_cause_any_instructions_to_be_trapped

tcf:enumItem.description: EL0, EL1, and EL2 accesses to the debug registers, other than the registers that can be trapped by MDCR_EL3.TDOSA, are trapped to EL3, from both Security states and both Execution states, unless it is trapped by DBGDSCRext.UDCCdis, MDSCR_EL1.TDCC, HDCR.TDA or MDCR_EL2.TDA.
tcf:enumItem.name: EL0_EL1_and_EL2_accesses_to_the_debug_registers_other_than_the_registers_that_can_be_trapped_by_MDCR_EL3

tcf:enumItem.description: This control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.
tcf:enumItem.name: This_control_does_not_cause_any_instructions_to_be_trapped

tcf:enumItem.description: EL2, EL1, and EL0 System register accesses to all Performance Monitors registers are trapped to EL3, unless it is trapped by HDCR.TPM or MDCR_EL2.TPM.
tcf:enumItem.name: EL2_EL1_and_EL0_System_register_accesses_to_all_Performance_Monitors_registers_are_trapped_to_EL3_unless_it_is_trapped_by_HDCR

tcf:enumItem.description: Does not trap accesses to record registers from EL1 and EL2 to EL3.
tcf:enumItem.name: Does_not_trap_accesses_to_record_registers_from_EL1_and_EL2_to_EL3

tcf:enumItem.description: Accesses to the ER* registers from EL1 and EL2 generate a Trap exception to EL3.
tcf:enumItem.name: Accesses_to_the_ER_registers_from_EL1_and_EL2_generate_a_Trap_exception_to_EL3

tcf:enumItem.description: This control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.
tcf:enumItem.name: This_control_does_not_cause_any_instructions_to_be_trapped

tcf:enumItem.description: EL1 and EL2 accesses to the LOR registers that are not UNDEFINED are trapped to EL3, unless it is trapped HCR_EL2.TLOR.
tcf:enumItem.name: EL1_and_EL2_accesses_to_the_LOR_registers_that_are_not_UNDEFINED_are_trapped_to_EL3_unless_it_is_trapped_HCR_EL2

tcf:enumItem.description: This control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.
tcf:enumItem.name: This_control_does_not_cause_any_instructions_to_be_trapped

tcf:enumItem.description: Any attempt to execute a WFE instruction at any Exception level lower than EL3 is trapped to EL3, if the instruction would otherwise have caused the PE to enter a low-power state and it is not trapped by SCTLR.nTWE, HCR.TWE, SCTLR_EL1.nTWE, SCTLR_EL2.nTWE, or HCR_EL2.TWE.
tcf:enumItem.name: Any_attempt_to_execute_a_WFE_instruction_at_any_Exception_level_lower_than_EL3_is_trapped_to_EL3_if_the_instruction_would_otherwise_have_caused_the_PE_to_enter_a_low_power_state_and_it_is_not_trapped_by_SCTLR

tcf:enumItem.description: This control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.
tcf:enumItem.name: This_control_does_not_cause_any_instructions_to_be_trapped

tcf:enumItem.description: Any attempt to execute a WFI instruction at any Exception level lower than EL3 is trapped to EL3, if the instruction would otherwise have caused the PE to enter a low-power state and it is not trapped by SCTLR.nTWI, HCR.TWI, SCTLR_EL1.nTWI, SCTLR_EL2.nTWI, or HCR_EL2.TWI.
tcf:enumItem.name: Any_attempt_to_execute_a_WFI_instruction_at_any_Exception_level_lower_than_EL3_is_trapped_to_EL3_if_the_instruction_would_otherwise_have_caused_the_PE_to_enter_a_low_power_state_and_it_is_not_trapped_by_SCTLR

tcf:enumItem.description: Secure EL1 using AArch64 accesses to the CNTPS_TVAL_EL1, CNTPS_CTL_EL1, and CNTPS_CVAL_EL1 are trapped to EL3.
tcf:enumItem.name: Secure_EL1_using_AArch64_accesses_to_the_CNTPS_TVAL_EL1_CNTPS_CTL_EL1_and_CNTPS_CVAL_EL1_are_trapped_to_EL3

tcf:enumItem.description: This control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.
tcf:enumItem.name: This_control_does_not_cause_any_instructions_to_be_trapped

tcf:enumItem.description: Lower levels are all AArch32.
tcf:enumItem.name: Lower_levels_are_all_AArch32

tcf:enumItem.description: The next lower level is AArch64...
tcf:enumItem.name: The_next_lower_level_is_AArch64

tcf:enumItem.description: Secure state instruction fetches from Non-secure memory are permitted.
tcf:enumItem.name: Secure_state_instruction_fetches_from_Non_secure_memory_are_permitted

tcf:enumItem.description: Secure state instruction fetches from Non-secure memory are not permitted.
tcf:enumItem.name: Secure_state_instruction_fetches_from_Non_secure_memory_are_not_permitted

tcf:enumItem.description: HVC instructions are UNDEFINED at EL3, EL2, and Non-secure EL1, and any resulting exception is taken from the current Exception level to the current Exception level.
tcf:enumItem.name: HVC_instructions_are_UNDEFINED_at_EL3_EL2_and_Non_secure_EL1_and_any_resulting_exception_is_taken_from_the_current_Exception_level_to_the_current_Exception_level

tcf:enumItem.description: HVC instructions are enabled at EL1 and above.
tcf:enumItem.name: HVC_instructions_are_enabled_at_EL1_and_above

tcf:enumItem.description: SMC instructions are enabled at EL1 and above.
tcf:enumItem.name: SMC_instructions_are_enabled_at_EL1_and_above

tcf:enumItem.description: SMC instructions are UNDEFINED at EL1 and above.
tcf:enumItem.name: SMC_instructions_are_UNDEFINED_at_EL1_and_above

tcf:enumItem.description: When executing at Exception levels below EL3, External Aborts and SError Interrupts are not taken to EL3...
tcf:enumItem.name: When_executing_at_Exception_levels_below_EL3_External_Aborts_and_SError_Interrupts_are_not_taken_to_EL3

tcf:enumItem.description: When executing at any Exception level, External Aborts and SError Interrupts are taken to EL3.
tcf:enumItem.name: When_executing_at_any_Exception_level_External_Aborts_and_SError_Interrupts_are_taken_to_EL3

tcf:enumItem.description: When executing at Exception levels below EL3, physical FIQ interrupts are not taken to EL3...
tcf:enumItem.name: When_executing_at_Exception_levels_below_EL3_physical_FIQ_interrupts_are_not_taken_to_EL3

tcf:enumItem.description: When executing at any Exception level, physical FIQ interrupts are taken to EL3.
tcf:enumItem.name: When_executing_at_any_Exception_level_physical_FIQ_interrupts_are_taken_to_EL3

tcf:enumItem.description: When executing at Exception levels below EL3, physical IRQ interrupts are not taken to EL3...
tcf:enumItem.name: When_executing_at_Exception_levels_below_EL3_physical_IRQ_interrupts_are_not_taken_to_EL3

tcf:enumItem.description: When executing at any Exception level, physical IRQ interrupts are taken to EL3.
tcf:enumItem.name: When_executing_at_any_Exception_level_physical_IRQ_interrupts_are_taken_to_EL3

tcf:enumItem.description: Indicates that EL0 and EL1 are in Secure state, and so memory accesses from those Exception levels can access Secure memory...
tcf:enumItem.name: Indicates_that_EL0_and_EL1_are_in_Secure_state_and_so_memory_accesses_from_those_Exception_levels_can_access_Secure_memory

tcf:enumItem.description: Indicates that EL0 and EL1 are in Non-secure state, and so memory accesses from those Exception levels cannot access Secure memory.
tcf:enumItem.name: Indicates_that_EL0_and_EL1_are_in_Non_secure_state_and_so_memory_accesses_from_those_Exception_levels_cannot_access_Secure_memory

tcf:enumItem.description: Performance Monitors event counting prohibited in Secure EL0 unless allowed by MDCR_EL3.SPME or the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED authentication interface ExternalSecureNoninvasiveDebugEnabled().
tcf:enumItem.name: Performance_Monitors_event_counting_prohibited_in_Secure_EL0_unless_allowed_by_MDCR_EL3

tcf:enumItem.description: Performance Monitors event counting allowed in Secure EL0.
tcf:enumItem.name: Performance_Monitors_event_counting_allowed_in_Secure_EL0

tcf:enumItem.description: Debug exceptions other than Breakpoint Instruction exceptions from Secure EL0 are disabled, unless enabled by MDCR_EL3.SPD32.
tcf:enumItem.name: Debug_exceptions_other_than_Breakpoint_Instruction_exceptions_from_Secure_EL0_are_disabled_unless_enabled_by_MDCR_EL3

tcf:enumItem.description: Debug exceptions from Secure EL0 are enabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: Debug_exceptions_from_Secure_EL0_are_enabled
